theorem φ(x) are sufﬁcient for θif and only if p(x|θ) can be written in the form
p(x|θ) = h(x)gθ(φ(x)) , (6.106)
where h(x) is a distribution independent of θand gθ captures all the depen-
dence on θvia sufﬁcient statistics φ(x).
If p(x|θ) does not depend onθ, then φ(x) is trivially a sufﬁcient statistic
for any function φ. The more interesting case is that p(x|θ) is dependent
only on φ(x) and not xitself. In this case, φ(x) is a sufﬁcient statistic for
θ.
